content:
Posted: June 15, 2015
Early Access Review
								Will it ever NOT be in early access? This is getting ridiculous, and I regret supporting an unfinished game, just like Starbound. It's been more than 4 years. 4 YEARS. The main menu's 'theme song' or whatever it is of the women moaning and ooo-ing is infuriating to listen to, you get injured once and your speed goes down to a crawl, and only injure yourself farther the more you move. Realistic, sure, but that doesn't mean it's fun when you get in 1 minor scuffle with a zombie and die 2 days later just trying to recover in bed. The world is dead, no NPC's around ever, it's just you waking up in some house surrounded by thousands of zombies in a town. I sometimes hear helicopters pass by over head, but I don't think those are actually for anything. I remember playing it a few years ago with that starting tutorial story with the injured wife and husband, that showed promise! where is that? where is ANYTHING like that? theres almost nothing to this game it feels. Theres farming, but you can just scavenge for food forever it seems. You can build safe houses, but why not just fortify an already built house? There are 2 maps and I can't tell the difference between either of them. You can level up your character but it doesn't seem to have any real impact on gameplay.You can venture around outside and get weapons and guns to make finding food easier because you don't need to worry about zombies so much, but then they break or run out of ammo and you need to find more weapons so you can find more food so you can survive longer so you can just repeat until you die. If there was actual NPC's to interact with then the game could start getting some semblence of a goal, you find some guy out in the city, befriend him, trade resources & help each other out, find more survivors and make a community together, all while dealing with zombies and hunger problems and other hostile survivors! But no, the game doesn't have that. This wouldn't annoy me so much if the game has only been around for a few months, but this simply isn't the case and the game has just sat in my library for years now even when I bought it back on Desura because it wasn't avaliable on steam.  Is 4 years not enough time to make a game and get it out of early access? Apparently not!  It feels like they're just using the term "Early Access" as a shield for their unfinished game they don't want to work on. But I don't know that, it's just what it feels like after waiting so long. The 15 hours i've played is more like 15 1 hour sessions checking to see if the game has gotten any better, and so far, I wish that I could refund this game.

								The game is ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•in' amazing, feels, and plays like a fully developed game. Yet, people will leave negative reviews since it's been in developement for a long time. The team's made of like 4-5 people, one of them recently having a kid. Most reviews will say something along the lines of:"No NPC's, no car's, repetitive gameplay"But the thing is, car's and NPC's aren't neccessary for the game to be good, it's still fun, and the best zombie survival simulator on the market, and if NPC's and car's are important for you there's mods for it.Definitely reccomend.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 8, 2015
Early Access Review
								Project Zomboid or PZ for short is one of the better survival games to have come out on steam. Don't let the pixel looking graphics fool you because the game offers quite a lot.  It is the attention to small detail in a game like this that makes it feel like what you're doing and the choices you made on your route mattered and made the difference between life and death.  Open a window to a house because the front door is locked, an alarm goes off! How will you deal with it? You've been bitten on the hand while playing with some friends. You're going to turn soon, do you tell them and maybe have them kill you where you stand for their safety or trek on like everything is okay.  Forget you've put something in the oven and then gone to sleep. Wake up toasted.  Project Zomboid is a good enough game to support but the devs make buying early access a pleasant experience. How the devs conduct themselves is partly why I jumped all over PZ and it was the best purchase I've made on steam to date.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 9, 2014
Early Access Review
								A great combination of retro graphics with modern gaming mechanics. I've been looking for a zombie apocalypse simulator that wouldn't kill the graphics card on my Mac and this game fits the bill! The game play reminds me a little bit of the looting mechanics of Diablo mixed in with the intricacies of character leveling and extensive crafting and cooking systems, there is a lot to discover. Not to mention the map is quite large. I've played about 15 hours now and I have barely covered a small portion of the map.I definitely recommend this game to everyone, there is something in the mechanics of the game for almost every type of player.Not to mention the multiplayer will be coming out eventually and that experience alone will change the feel of the entire game. Definitely something to look forward to!

content:

Early Access Review
								Some final moments of mine.Got trapped in the bathroom of a building surrounded by zombies. Decided to smoke a pack of cigarettes, drink out of the toilet, and eat some dog food as my ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• last meal. Turns out this wasn't my final moment as I somehow survived and ran away. I think I died of embarrassment later.Got bit after surviving for 50 days so I made a three story building, drank a jug of bleach, and swan dived off of my newly made masterpiece.Decided I didn't wanted to get nommed to death so I set the house on fire by cooking a rotting dead rat.Ran away from a single zombie only to take a wrong turn and stumble into a pack of zombies right around the corner.Made a molotov, 'dropped' (didn't throw far enough) it and lit myself on fire and then ran into a horde of zombies to light them on fire.I just wanted to see how fast acting bleach was.My friend stabbed me with a butter knife while I was AFK and I bled to death.10/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 6, 2014
Early Access Review
								In my opinion, it's the greatest zombie simulation game I've ever played.  Sure it doesn't have the graphics or that First-Person Shooter feeling of a game like Dayz, but there's much more freedom and it's a more realistic experience.  You can build, barricade, farm.  And now I hear it's even multiplayer.  You have more things to worry about than just food, water, and health.  There's boredom, depression, fear, anger, pain, and sickness.  The character creation is interesting because you can get bonuses based on what your previous job was.  You can also pick strengths and weaknesses.  For example: You be claustrophobic (+4) and Short sighted (+2) but then you could be Athletic (-6).  The game isn't even finished yet and I'm still impressed.  Definately worth the $14.99.

Early Access Review
								This game is the true zombie apocalypse experience, where you feel an overwhelming sense of, I'm screwed. Where household items can be weapons, and zombies watch you rummage through a house. This game will try to kill you within the minute of you starting it. The Game holds no punches and has one goal, to make your day a living hell, and you love it you masochistic freak. So what are you waiting for, Join your friends, live your zombie apocolypse dream experience, and then tell the whole world that you wished you bought this sooner. see you on the other side.Camthebandit 3 Months after initial outbreak

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 6, 2014
Early Access Review
								I was put off buying this game due to the graphics but gave in after reading some of the other reviews on here and discovered that I love this game. It seems game mechanics overshadow pretty graphics.Project Zomboid is an amazing Zombie survival game. All the times I've played I have yet to use a gun which in my opinion is one of the best aspects of gameplay.With not only the constant threat of being eaten by zombies there is also the threat of infection, dehydration, starvation, exposure. All these different elements trying to kill you make you genuinely care about death (a rare thing in any game).I would definitely recommend this game to any fan of the zombie genre who is sick of fps cannon fodder fests.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 8, 2014
Early Access Review
								I can't remember what I expected from this game before buying it.  I think I was looking at a typical hack and slash game.  A friend recommended it, so I gave it a go.  I'm glad I did.An hour into the game, I still wasn't sure what I was playing.  I liked the passage of time, the needing to eat and drink, and finding better weapons, but that was barely scratching the surface.I learned to build new objects (by learn, I mean I figured out that I could do it...  you don't need to find plans, or anything, as the game just lets you know what you need after you find a hammer).  I thought I was doing well, and was a little worried that this game was going to end up being Farmville with zombies...  then the power and water went out, and I was left unable to cook food easily.  Without power, there's no refrigeration, and perishables will rot.  Now, it's a battle for survival not just against zombies, but against time, and your own biology.  Hunger and thirst are as dangerous as any biter.  The rain which was an inconvenience before is now essential, and it doesn't come along often enough for my liking.If you're on the fence about this game, just pick it up.  Farmville, it ain't.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 14, 2014
Early Access Review
								"a zombie game thats main focus was the elements of survival not the zombies themselves"I followed this game about a year before it popped on steam, unfortunately, I lost my previous copy due to tranferring computers. But I bought a second copy and noticed the improvement. This is a game where you die. No avoiding it. You just die eventually, which i've seen a few people question what the point was. Theres your answer. But its dependant on how soon you die, how your fate is sealed, is what makes this game enjoyable.Graphics are simple, but improved before early access. It does use a console though, which says something. Options isn't high quality, but its acceptable.The game is quite impressive of making you learn from your mistakes. You get to create a character and apply him with perks and also change how the world works. The perk system is a counter-weighing system, allowing you to have positive perks, as long as you weigh it with negatives. The game itself is quite difficult at first, any encounter with a zombie can have you infected and dead, but if you really want to, you can live with the infection, it'll just be harder. Zombies themselves are quite brutal, but easy when alone. they have senses, so guns shouldn't be your first option and you should allways make sure your not being stalked. Random events occur aswell, such as burgular alarms, gunshots and helicopter flybys. Don't expect to be saved though, these just rile up the zeds.Personally I've been looking for a zombie game thats main focus was the elements of survival not the zombies themselves, and this is what the developers seemed to be achieving, however it just needs more mechanics and complications. Being in early access does mean it'll be improved and I can't wait to see the final product.8/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 22, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game is very deep, definately don't judge a book by its cover here, or should I say a game by its screenshots.  True the graphics are basic, but the gameplay is challenging and fun.  Its definately alot harder than it looks, the zombies are relentless and you will die very quickly your first few run throughs.  Take it slow and cautious, don't leave a safe house unless your sure you can make it to another one.  If you manage to survive more than the first few weeks, you will start to level up your character and can explore all the options for survival and crafting that the game has to discover.

content:
Posted: July 21, 2014
Early Access Review
								Project Zomboid... Project Zomboid.... Project Zomboid. Ooooooh Project Zomboid, how you have messed my life up completely. Me and my friend bought this game to play with one another, but to our amazing shock, we can't. I tried joining servers, tried making a server and hosting it myself on my computer so that we could just play. Why so complicate? Why so stupid? Why ruin my entire life on a game that won't let me play multiplayer with my friend? It's all I want, it's all I've ever wanted in my whole desires, just to play Project Zomboid with my friend. Hah, more like Project Failboid. I'm not happy with this and it makes me upset, my life is over.But on the other hand, this game is absolutely amazing and is super fun to play. I love how in depth it goes, ripping off sheets and having to put them on the windows so the zombies can't see you. This is so damn awesome! Thanks for the game guys. Definitely recommended. :D

content:

Early Access Review
								Okay I have played this for 9 hours straight and haven't got bored yet. When it says "This is how you died," I remember that I will actually die at some point. This game is really fun but at the same time, really challenging. My friend and I (playing on the multiplayer beta) have dealt with hordes, multiple houses caught on fire, alarms in many houses, a helicopter drawing zombies to our position, and much more. And we've barely scratched the surface. We've probably cleared out, say, maybe 2 neighborhoods of supplies, and maybe a little more. I got scratched once and ended up being unlucky enough for it to be a scratch to the head. I died of infection. This game is so fun that even cooking or reading "Advanced Farming" can be fun. You should get this game now.Pros:Super Fun, Yet challengingI can't even say anything else, just everything is good basically.Cons:Multiplayer doesn't have everything (yet)Some houses have furniture in... let's say... interesting places.

								Great game, with a lot of bugs which is to be expected of an early access game. HOWEVER, the multiplayer crashes and causes loss of player data causing them to restart completely. I understand early access, but dont release a feature that could wipe all progress until it's fully tested. Game dev 101.  Good game, but please PLEASE fix at least the alpha version features. This game has been in development too long to have character saves lost left and right. I've loved this game far too long, but even I'm getting close to losing hope. I wouldn't buy until the full release is out, if it ever comes. I still reccommend but don't expect to return to a character the next day.

								"How will you die" I just started playing this game. I really like this game there is so much to do and find. It is about "YOU". About how "YOU" will die in the the zombie apocalyps. Thats the point of the game, but dont give up. Keep trying. You will get bored but you will come right back to the game. In a couple mins.  When i play this game i like to think of walking dead. (I'm not saying they ripped off of Walking Dead, but it is a zombie game) It feels like i am really in the zombie apocalyps and I like it more then Dayz.  If you want a realistic zombie game here you go! I know people say Dayz is realistc, but this game is better. You will see how this game is better then Dayz in a couple mins of playing. There is SOO MUCH MORE TO THIS! Just look at the current features.  Remember, this is early accses so that means their are some bugs and their is a lot more to come to this game.   I really like this game so far and i want you to get it to. There is a singleplayer and i think there is mp but not sure, but they are coming with some. So get this game it is a blast of fun!

content:
Posted: March 9, 2014
Early Access Review
								A great combination of retro graphics with modern gaming mechanics. I've been looking for a zombie apocalypse simulator that wouldn't kill the graphics card on my Mac and this game fits the bill! The game play reminds me a little bit of the looting mechanics of Diablo mixed in with the intricacies of character leveling and extensive crafting and cooking systems, there is a lot to discover. Not to mention the map is quite large. I've played about 15 hours now and I have barely covered a small portion of the map.I definitely recommend this game to everyone, there is something in the mechanics of the game for almost every type of player.Not to mention the multiplayer will be coming out eventually and that experience alone will change the feel of the entire game. Definitely something to look forward to!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 29, 2014
Early Access Review
								'The Promising Early Access Title from Indie Stone'I wanted to wait to be more experienced before writing this review, but couldn't at all! This game will have you jumping from the first minute you start playing, to the last, even when you half expect a Zombie to be hidden in a bathroom waiting for you to open a door, it still shocks you, with its gripping yet gory soundtrack, to the way they lunge towards you from the darkness.Once you've done some messing around with pressing buttons, you will find crafting and cooking very easy to work out too, with a little help from the wikia on what food items go into what food recipes, you're away, making yourself Grilled Cheese Sarnies, Soup and Coffee.My first major mistake, and the first way this game managed to fulfil its promise in killing me, was letting me find a pistol and some ammo early on. Feeling powerful, I fired off some shots at oncoming Zeds, before I knew it I was out of ammo, with a Horde chasing me down, unable to get away, I slowly got eaten, limb to limb. After a few deaths and happy mistakes, you realise your own play-style and quickly develop dynamic ways to stay alive.This game is still in Beta, but its showing great promise, and from the moment you start to play, you won't be able to put it down and stop.With Indie Stone working on a stable multiplayer for this game, and currently in the progress of changing to a better engine and more features and skills to rank. I'm looking forward to the future of this game.

content:
Posted: February 28, 2014
Early Access Review
								Project zomboid is a awesome zombie survival game. The game is very realistic as are the zombies. While I think this is a awesome game, it might not be your cup of tea. This game IS NOT ABOUT KILLING ZOMBIES. A lot of people might make that mistake. This game is about survival. Hoarding a lot of food and water, securing a safe house and trying to dodge the zombie hoards. You don't just charge into a group of 10 zombies bat swinging. That's how you get killed. The devs highly recommend trying out the demo first, which is a good idea as the game can be buggy and it has not been optimized very much as of yet.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 7, 2014
Early Access Review
								An absolutely thrilling experience that compines the tedious work of basic survival with the intensity of flesh-eating zombies.  The soundtrack adds an eerie atmosphere to the game; the graphics, although not considered good looking, they have come to grow on me.  The style of the graphics really fits the tone of the game.  This game truly and honestly allows the player to experience zombie surival at it's best and most realistic.  The game is also being updated it seems somewhat frequently, making the game significantly better with each update.  I highly recommend this game to anyone who enjoys zombie survival games at all.  Even if you don't think you do, try it out with the demo; this game provides a never-before-seen experience that I have really enjoyed.  I love this game!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 29, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game is the only true zombie survival simulator. Sure, It doesn't have realistic graphics or first person mode like DayZ but this game is friggin HARD. You can go out, get yourself a shotgun and try to take down a hoard but more and more will be attracted to the sounds of your shots so you'd better have enough shells to take down every zombie in the sound radius. You'll need food and water, while you can get plenty of food your perishables will spoil and there's only so much ramen and jerky in the world. You'll need to keep moving into more and more dangerous areas. Water will be cut off so you'd better have a good stockpile of it before it runs out.I could really go on, Barricading your house, finding new food sources, finally saving enough bullets to take out a hoard and get though the cities but all I REALLY need to say is this. If you think you're a badass that will survive the zombie apocolypse think again. This game will show you no matter how badass you are, you're nobody special. It only takes one mistake on your part and you're zombie food. So yes, Buy this game. Hell, Buy 8 copies of it. This game is amazing.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 16, 2015
Early Access Review
								A solid title that stays true to the survival genre, and stands out in a sea of overdone zombie games.Pros+ Highly interactive world, with lots of choices and a lot of freedom (e.g. you can fish, cook, farm, craft, build a safehouse, drink bleach and die, etc.)+ Good number of realistic and detailed survival mechanics+ Lots of items, with many uses (e.g. you can form a rope by stringing clothes together to descend from higher ground safely, or rip said clothes to create makeshift bandages)+ Unique traits system (balance good and bad traits when building characters)+ Very large maps with a variety of locations (e.g. neighbourhoods, town squares, beaches, forests)+ Includes a very flexible sandbox mode that allows players to customise the world, the zombies, and player settings (you can even go against running zombies for the whole 28 Days Later experience)+ Ability to speed up time up to 3x, reduces wait time for time-consuming tasks+ Supports both online (up to 64 players) and local (split-screen, up to 4 players) multiplayer+ Zombies can jump scare you+ Has official modding tools and level editorCons- UI design is not very user-friendly and intuitive, may take some time to get used to- Controls are not very intuitive, and gamepad does not play well with some UI elements- Lack of map system to see where you're going, with many long roads that lead nowhere - you may sometimes go for long walks and never come back (although vehicles are planned for future releases)- Currently, lacks a storyline or at least objectives to work towards (purely sandbox as of now), so like most survival games (The Forest, The Long Dark, DayZ, etc.) you pretty much make your own goals - may be dull for some; but from what I understand, there will be a story mode in the final versionOverallGiven that this game is still in Early Access8.5 / 10

Early Access Review
								Despite a few bugs (as is expected from early release) I can see great care, and great quality being put into this game. Definitely pick it up now if you'd like a great, and unique zombie experience. There will be bugs, but investing will allow you to see the process of this games development. There's lots to do, lots to interact, and a level of realism that can't be found in other zombie games. I would actually more call this a zombie simulator, and for once survival is actually pretty tough. I got thirsty in game, and it took a long time to find fresh water, there was points where I got swarmed by zombies and had to run. You are not invincible in this game, it is the Dark Souls of the zombie subgenre. RECOMMEND FOR SURE.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 16, 2014
Early Access Review
								Project Zomboid, even at it's current stage of development, is probably THE best zombie suvival game out. No question.Other games like DayZ and The Dead Linger don't even come close. (Even though they're also really early in development). Even with Project Zomboid's recent updates that add multiplayer, it's impossible for it to turn into the deathmatch with zombies as a back drop like DayZ. The zombies are actually a huge threat in Project Zomboid, which is really the best thing about it. You fear them, because one bite, even one little scratch will eventually kill you. A horde that happens to pass through could chase you out of the safehouse you worked for many real-life hours to fortify and stock full of gear and supples. The survival elements are really deep, despite not being anywear near finsihed, and the problems it does have I won't nit pick about because of that reason. Of course there are some problems. Nothing major, and I'm pretty sure they'll add it in due time but hygenie should be an element in the game, and it should effect happiness/saddness. And you should be able to watch TV or play games for entertainment (as long as the power is on, and use batteries for portable games). The only real issues I have with the game is the overall graphics, and the fact they took out NPCs that were in ealier versions of the game, I know they're going to come back but it really made me sad that they did that. The blood splatters look great, but that's wear my praise for the graphics end. I don't like how the game looks, they're should be something there that gives the game a darker tone, because the spirtes and graphics look a bit cartoonish in my opinion. I think some special effects should be added to make the game look more pretty, like fog/fancy lighting/etc. That doesn't make me love the game any less, but it would increase the immersion to me.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 26, 2015
Early Access Review
								I must say, this game sure has it's charms. Let me tell you of my most recent experience in Muldraugh. I Started the game and set out for a place to call home. Ran until I came to the commercial district of town, and took up residence in a small apartment building. Managed to loot several stores nearby and got a decent amount of food and tools. Food kept and water was abundant, until the power failed across the city. I eventually set out to find a hammer to fortify the doors below the apartment I was in and a generator to power the facilities inside the building itself. In the process I found more food and even a shotgun, with a stockpile of shells. Thinking I could take on the world, I disposed of 3 zombies around the apartment building. Big Mistake. The entire building was surrounded within minutes and I had no safe way to get out. I decided to jump out one of the windows in my apartment room after the horde busted down my door. Sadly I ended up with a fracture and moved at a snail's pace. As the horde surrounded me I began taking large quantites of zombies out with the help of my fully loaded shotgun, but I eventually ran out of steam, shells, and time. I was eaten alive and pretty ticked off at the fact that I lost all that progress, but man it was a good run indeed.I highly recommend this game, It's got that indie feel to it, but fleshes it out to the point where it becomes a very interesting and time consuming game!

content:
Posted: December 11, 2013
Early Access Review
								Phenomenal game.  Still in early Beta, but they are working on the bugs and fixing them fast.  I have been playing a few days, made several bug reports, and they have fixed every bug so far.The idea behind the game is a zombie survival game, but it doesnt stop there.  They have multiple game modes functioning already (survival / sandbox / last stand), they have plans for more as they work out bugs and improve content.  Eventually to include multiplayer / co-op, which is a huge plus for me.Actual gameplay is great, theres cooking, crafting, killing.  You can really build your character as you play through the game, via skill points, which are earned from experience from doing one of the aformentioned tasks.Anything you can imagine in the zombie / horror genre is either in the game, or being implemented in the game.Highly highly recommend to anyone.

								Project Zomboid... Project Zomboid.... Project Zomboid. Ooooooh Project Zomboid, how you have messed my life up completely. Me and my friend bought this game to play with one another, but to our amazing shock, we can't. I tried joining servers, tried making a server and hosting it myself on my computer so that we could just play. Why so complicate? Why so stupid? Why ruin my entire life on a game that won't let me play multiplayer with my friend? It's all I want, it's all I've ever wanted in my whole desires, just to play Project Zomboid with my friend. Hah, more like Project Failboid. I'm not happy with this and it makes me upset, my life is over.But on the other hand, this game is absolutely amazing and is super fun to play. I love how in depth it goes, ripping off sheets and having to put them on the windows so the zombies can't see you. This is so damn awesome! Thanks for the game guys. Definitely recommended. :D

								This is how it would be if the zombie apocalypse happened. No one is immune you can't just run into a horde and shotgun your way around, you become infected from scratchs/bites. Gotta keep warm depending on the time of year. Craft rain barrels to get water after the towns water gets cut off (presumably by the military). Random gun shots/jets and helicopters fly over attracting zombies, forcing a mass zombie migration halfway across the map. Loot, craft, build, move. Rinse and repeat just don't get scratched bitten or catch the flu. Great game. Graphics are a little iffy but I play for the realistic gameplay.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 17, 2014
Early Access Review
								I have to say, this game is so realistic, unforgiving, brutal and overwhelming, that I have found my self spending hours into this game and it is not even away from Early Access...There are bugs here and there, but thats usualy players fault(trying to vault into a wall and getting stuck is your fault) which I've learned to avoid(after I made a battalion of survivors die under my watch).Gameplay is very good, crafting, hunger, emotions, the ever inreaseing zombie danger all add up to making the player more freaked out then the charater(like that friend of mine and his character who've lived more then I totaly played).Zombie are well defined, the Sandbox mode even gives you choice to make your own enviroment, from making zombie die from a spoon attack, make them slower then a snail, to making them run faster then super man and hit just as hard, making even garbage a precious loot to having grenades in night stands.They tend to move(group up) into hordes, and if you played State of Decay (another excellet zombie game) you will know that unless you remove those hordes they'll just keep pileing up, doing that is risky on it's own level.Graphics are 2D (might be a troll but I've heard forum guys say its going 3D) but still well done, the movement and player actions are fluid, adjusting to every little thing you've cought up, from being light weight, to minor injury, and heavy load combines with massive blood loss(This happen, and you might as well start a new character)The building/crafting/fortifying is also and decently made feature, from water collecting barrels, to good 'ol wood walls and nails and hammer barricading. The immagination is your limit(and well, resources D: and zombies around them)For the future updates of NPCs and more spicy stuff I believe this indie game will have its spot in the light as an brilliantly made survival(Everyone dies eventualy survival) game that will make a mark, just for the developers to finish and polish is so well we're gonna need welder helms to look at it :DOverall 79/100Update #1 : Still after many weeks playing this, game is so compeling and addictive, feeling the pain and anger after having your little mate die to some random cough you picked up while looking for some more bacon bits and some tuna cans.Don't be fooled by only 7 hours of playtime showed, I have over 400 and going on and on while offline, I might even eventualy break the game when it hits v1.0, and I will be happy to try and do so like a bear inside a bee hive while all the bees are out playing dodgeball :)Update #2 They have added multiplayer... My first reaction "GRIM YOU'RE HERE I CAN SEE YOU! WOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!" (Grim was my teammate).Currently buggy as hell, but at least has a PvP toggle so removes some banditing around, but is starting to get abused, overall its on a good road and I'll be waiting for more!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 18, 2014
Early Access Review
								I have not put in a lot of time into this game, I will be honest.  But I have played it.  And I have died.  Many times.  More than I think I can reliably count.  And yet I come back and live a little longer eeach time.This is an early access game, no mistake.  But it is still worth it.  These guys have already made a good game - the mechanisms are there.  The game is there.  Does it bug a little?  Sure.  Could it be prettier?  Yeah, definitely.  But these guys took a Dwarf Fortresss approach before they went to Steam; they wanted a SOLID, GOOD game, not a pretty, so-so game.  Already I'd say it's worth the money, and theese are still working on it.  It'll only get better.Would buy again.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 28, 2014
Early Access Review
								You're not likely to ever find another zombie game, or straight up survival game, with as much freedom as Project Zomboid. Build a base in any building you find in the map, or build your own from scratch. Forrage, fish, and hunt to avoid the hoards, or risk runs into the city to nab your suppiles there. Use the extensive crafting menus to create all kinds of walls, weapons, and survival supplies, or stick with whatever you pick up.What I love about PZ, is that everything you do has weight. With only saving every time you sleep, close the game, or die, you have to be very careful and really weight out the pros and cons of everything you do. There are no second chances here, one bite and you're dead. Maybe not right away, but give it time.Even though this game is still being updated and filled in, it feels so complete right now, that I can not stress enough that it is worth your money even if you are only slightly interested.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 25, 2015
Early Access Review
								I start my day like any other as I wake up and look through my bedroom window. Apparently the zombie apocalypse has happened.. The first thing to do on my agenda is scrounge my house for supplies and weapons, sadly the world seems to have a cruel sense of humor, as the only weapon at my disposal is a butter knife. However that and my meager supply of food will have to do. I step out into the dead and lonely world only to find... It's not as lonely as I expected it to be. Only when the "company" is a horde of zombies around every street corner begging for "just a bite" of my flesh I would much rather it to be a lonely world. I was forced to come to the quick realization that walking out the front door was nothing short of ringing a dinner bell and not my most thought out plan, and a butter knife not the most relyable weapon as my life quickly came to an end the very day I started it. This is pretty much how easily day 1 can come and end in project zomboid, all depending on where you spawn, the zombies in the area, and how sadistic the game wants to be with what spawns in your starting house, along with your own skills of course. This only compounds to the fact the game begins turning off resources such as water and electricity. Also did you establish a well fortified base in a lowly zombie populated area? That's great, except for the fact I think I hear a helicopter flying over said base and now there seems to be an army of the dead shambling your way, I hope there's a backup plan in mind. Zomboid is easily one of the more sadistic games out there right now and funnily enough that is it's greatest appeal.

content:

Early Access Review
								Despite a few bugs (as is expected from early release) I can see great care, and great quality being put into this game. Definitely pick it up now if you'd like a great, and unique zombie experience. There will be bugs, but investing will allow you to see the process of this games development. There's lots to do, lots to interact, and a level of realism that can't be found in other zombie games. I would actually more call this a zombie simulator, and for once survival is actually pretty tough. I got thirsty in game, and it took a long time to find fresh water, there was points where I got swarmed by zombies and had to run. You are not invincible in this game, it is the Dark Souls of the zombie subgenre. RECOMMEND FOR SURE.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 21, 2014
Early Access Review
								I remember when I first found Project Zomboid. The systems were basic, I was playing the demo of just trying to keep Kate(was it?) alive when the neighbor came in and killed her and possibly you too. The game was one of the most fun things I had ever played. Now that it's at Build 30 and there's even more coming, such as vehicles and actually functional NPCs, the developers haven't failed to impress. An intermediate medical system, amazing fortbuilding and survivability half-simulation, half-survival game. Now even winter comes and the world deteriorates, as do the zombies. This is a game that promises that you WILL die. That's inevitable. It's all about delaying the inevitable. Right now, multiplayer is shaky and laggy, but given that it's been 3 years in waiting, the multiplayer is beautiful and it will be given the works very soon. All in all, I give it a 10/10. One of the best games that I've played. It has good replay value and plenty of entirely player-determined goals to go for. Did I mention the farming?

content:
Posted: October 8, 2014
Early Access Review
								I bought Project Zomboid three days ago, so far I've played 30 hours. If that doesn't speak volumes about it I don't know what does.Good points:‚Ä¢ Very active and constistant developers (and friendly).‚Ä¢ Lots of updates and planned updates/additions to gameplay.‚Ä¢ Cheap... I feel guilty for buying it on sale, believe me.‚Ä¢ HUGE map, I don't care if it's not randomly generated, it takes a while to memorize due to the sheer scale.‚Ä¢ So many items, more to be implemented.‚Ä¢ Interesting building, moodles, skills, crafting and actions.‚Ä¢ Fairly difficult until you become more knowledgable, even so it can rip you a new one sometimes. Difficulty will even be ramped up for long surviving characters so a huge bonus for those of us who enjoy getting their arses handed to them.‚Ä¢ Multiplayer, cry in a corner with friends!‚Ä¢ NPCs to be added, this should really change up each playthrough.‚Ä¢ The music.... holy god damn the music. I adore it.Bad points:‚Ä¢ Too addictive.In short, try the demo, fall in love and throw your love and money at the developers.P.S. Put a propane tank in an oven, turn it on and enjoy the mayhem. You're welcome.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 13, 2014
Early Access Review
								If you're looking for killing zombies then this game is not for youSeriously, this game put much emphasis on survival. You need to take care a lot of things, like you need to eat, drink, watch for your health and even entertained (by reading books and magazine of course, not that kind of "entertaintment"). A lot of status could affect the character, got hit by a zombie and your character will feel pain then your hit won't be as hard as before, when you're panicked you could miss a swing or two, when you feel cold you could get sick, when you feel hot you get dehydrated easily, and many more...A lot of skills also put in consideration for your character, like how much your skill in aim will affect how good you are at shooting zombies (higher aim, higher chances for headshot), sprint skill affect how long you can run before you're tired, and others that I forgot. Besides fighting skill, there are also cooking, farming, and crafting, all of them are self explanatory. To level up your skills, you just need to do a certain action that related to the skill(s) you want to raise, like if you want to raise your blunt weapon skill, just keep using that rolling pin. Unfortunately, for sneaking, It's quite hard to do unless you have light feet trait. Since there's no crouch or stealth button, the only way to level up sneaking is walk past behind a zombie hoping you didn't attract him.Besides skill, there are also character traits. And I must say not a lot of other zombie survival game paid enough attention on this. The charm of the game is this, and also what make this game interesting. The character creation is quite simple and not so detailer, but the character trait is not. You need to choose both bad traits and good traits, since bad traits adding points to spend on good traits, so there will be no character with only good traits. Also, the traits are balanced, want more good traits? Good luck, you also need more bad traits. Some bad/good traits will eliminate other bad/good traits, like it's not logic if you have both strength and feeble traits.At first, there were tutorial in game, but they took them out because they want to polish the game features first. The tutorial is iirc connected to the story with the guy on the cover, and also good for beginners. But, before the NPC is featured in the game, tutorial is not there and you need to hang on with hints or wiki or guide provided by other player. But don't worry, for basic survival, like scavenging, first aid, and the other, it's quite easy to do. If you can use your logic or experienced with fallout 1 or 2 (maybe 3), you won't get trouble. The problem comes with crafting and farming, since there's no tutorial in-game, you need to lookup guide and/or tutorial online. Zombies are threat, I repeat, zombies are treat. A couple of zombies won't give you much trouble, but a herd of zombies will. Also, they are quite persistent in following you. Just make sure you lock the door and window when you go to sleep. As for human enemy, since there's no NPC yet and I haven't tried pub, so I can't say much. tl;dr A great zombie survival simulator, the downside is there's no in-game tutorial and NPC yet, but the multiplayer and single player are good, I recommend you try the demo first

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 18, 2014
Early Access Review
								Project Zomboid is actually the only game I would call a Zombie Survival Simulator as of today. A Challenging Basis to it even adds how realistic the game truely is.  Games like Dead Island are interesting but I would probably not call them survival simualators. Left 4 Dead, Resident Evil (even though im a big Resident Evil fan) & The Walking Dead Game are all amazing gameplay, love the storylines, amazing graphics & even the Characters are loveable but they all don't really get the survival simulation that we are all looking for. I personaly think that DayZ is interesting but it's too much of a death match shooter, lacking ambitious crafting and sheltering. Although it came pretty close.  Beware the game can be stressful and challenging as I would hope a survival game would be. Its almost like playing a twisted version of the Sims.

Early Access Review
								Finally a Zombie survival game that does it right. Where the game stands now I can recommend that you will have alot of fun and with the latest update it just got more intense.Top down 16 bit graphics brings me back to SNES days but so much more devoloped than the games I played when I was young. with all the skill sets it can be a little overwhelming at first but it's really simple to learn, and I have to say the learning curve is a bit realistic when it comes to gameplay. Like common sense does play a role when cooking in the game. I love the fact that you have to eat and drink but are not forced to by losing your health overtime, and it doesnt feel like im doing that 20 times a day to stay full, Great game would have payed full price for it. Hope to see some great future updates.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 16, 2013
Early Access Review
								A very fun zombie sandbox survival game that pits you agianst hords of zombies while you try to survive for as long as possible. There is no hope. There is no cure. This is how you die. It reintroduces ideas of zombie games such as farming and healing your own wounds, but it brings to the table new ones such as if you get bit, to prevent from getting infected you can cut off the limb thats bitten before the infection takes you over. They are also working on npc survivors that you can befriend and use to help defend your base. By the way you can build your own base. That's right, but good luck finding the fire axe to chop down trees to get wood, the nails, and a hammer to put it all together. Yes there are some glitchs, but compared to what they were years ago when I first started playing it, they went a long way from where they started. They are also planning to add muiltiplayer so when that comes out, that's when the game will get really good. Some gamers might not like it because they're times where its enraging to find an area without zombies to make a safe spot, but if you start playing enough, you'll come to understand that where ever you start, thats what you are going to get, unless you kill most of the zombies in an area you want to make your base. They orginally had a story mode where you took care of your injured wife, but it isn't in there anymore and it's what the title screen is based off of. Lastly the one thing I learned from this game is that GUNS ARE A BAD IDEA, not only are they loud, this was proven on mythbusters, but the time it takes to aim, shoot and reload, is enough time for them to over run you and kill you. So yeah, to the people who think the shotgun or the chainsaw is the best weapon againse a zombie you are dead wrong... Well... undead wrong I should say...

Updates are very consistent and nearly always add more content to the game (unless it‚Äôs a bug fix update which are also frequent).If you‚Äôre the type of person that enjoys a completely realistic and immersive, zombie apocalyptic experience, where every character has a different to story to tell, with every play through. Then Project Zomboid is for YOU.

content:
Posted: March 7, 2014
Early Access Review
								This is how it would be if the zombie apocalypse happened. No one is immune you can't just run into a horde and shotgun your way around, you become infected from scratchs/bites. Gotta keep warm depending on the time of year. Craft rain barrels to get water after the towns water gets cut off (presumably by the military). Random gun shots/jets and helicopters fly over attracting zombies, forcing a mass zombie migration halfway across the map. Loot, craft, build, move. Rinse and repeat just don't get scratched bitten or catch the flu. Great game. Graphics are a little iffy but I play for the realistic gameplay.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								I bought this game on sale expecting very little, but looking for the zombie game that really feels like an apocalypse - not a shooting gallery. Surely, I love playing a round of L4D or KF now and then but in truth they are only satisfying for their shooter components, settings, and funny physics. Project Zomboid is nothing like that. The first time I fired the game up it told me, "This is the story of how you died." Of course that got the philosopher in me interested. After all, don't you "die" in every video game, but usually with little consequence? Well, that first game, I lasted a mere minutes (4 hours of game time). From that moment, I realized that there was a lot more to this game than I was expecting, and a lot more than some of the other early access zombie games offer. Are there still bugs? Yes. Is everything in the game that should be? No.But what the game does to its player transcends what most games do. It makes you really care about how you live and die in the zombie apocalypse. And for that, and because it is (in my experience) without any game breaking bugs, this game deserves a 10/10. Someone should have made something like it 10 years ago. I would still be playing it.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 24, 2014
Early Access Review
								Very fun game indeed, even in its early stages.I could see myself playing many hours of this game.To be honest i really havnt found anything wrong, or that i dislike about it.A very well done top down zombie survival game.So many things, even very tiny aspects of the game, are done to profection.The game includes a feature that can be epic/annoying - the sounds of gunshots are added and can be heard ( no one is doing this, its just a random event)Zombies follow the sound of the shots moving them from place to place.One day i was working on my farm. there were many gunshots in my area..I knew what i had to do... I grabbed every piece of wependry i had and went outsideI could see the horde in the distance. I had to defend my base.It waves of undead seemed endlessAfter i ran out of ammo, broke every baseball bat, pan, hammer, and axe i had i ran back inside my houseand nailed every door shut..I knew it was the end... I walked inside my bedroom, opened the the storage box, and grabbed bleach and sleeping pillsI took them both and went to sleep in a chair.11/10Would play again

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 27, 2014
Early Access Review
								Already a fantastic game, and still getting better.Fun in singleplayer, the recent addition of multiplayer has really placed this high on my games to play.For anyone who enjoyed Don't Starve and/or wanted a multiplayer option in Don't Starve, you should really try this game.The art style is nice, the sounds are effective, and the music is immersive and really sets the tone for the game.  The gameplay is solid and the controls are actually quite simple.I like that it's not a jump-scare game.  It's not a nightmare-inducing horror game, just set in a horror setting.  The zombies are well made and work logically: You can take a few on, but a whole hoard is a serious problem.  Has the makings and elements of replayability, and multiplayer really ups that a long way.  Losing isn't the end, either, as you can make a new character in the same world, so you can "reclaim" your base.Modding is also a key point to the game design, which increases the scope and versatility of the game a lot, allowing people to play the way they want to.

								This game has been in development for a while now, I remember hearing about it at least 2 years ago, at its made progress since then. The development has been quite slow for this game, I will give them that they had faced numerous events that caused this that other companies normally don't, but it would be nice if there were more features in this game and less glitches. That being said, it has a great idea that it is centralized around. Surviving zombies is the least of your troubles when you are starving, cold, dying of thirst, and panicing all at the same time. The struggle for survival goes much deeper than the zombies and once the town's water supply is cut off and food starts to dwindle, things get exciting. This is what the game has going for it. I would give it a 7/10.

								This is how it would be if the zombie apocalypse happened. No one is immune you can't just run into a horde and shotgun your way around, you become infected from scratchs/bites. content:
Posted: July 6, 2014
Early Access Review
								Project Zomboid Is a Helicopter view zombie survival where you have to run around gathering supplies Almost every item has its use. Zombies actually are smart in this game they can see you, smell you, and hear you, there are many Dire situation you could get into while looting stuff for example I could break into a house and the alarm might go off alerting every zombie in the area and directing them to the location.You actually have to be smart while playing this, you have to have strategies for almost every situation for example if an alarm goes off in a house find a an escape route with the least amount of zombies. Never have I been so terrified of the AI because if you get careless well you're as good as done.Zombies actually have memories they'll remember which direction you were going and follow that direction even if you're out of their sight Zombies a force to be reckoned with.this game does have its problems but it's expected since it's in Alpha.How will you die?Rating 9.7/10

								Ah Project Zomboid. Definitley my favourite game to date it just realises the scenario of a zombie apocalypse to the maximium. I just love how you can just read the zombie survival guide and use it as it's own tourtorial you don't even need to have a tourtorial for the game, it's how the player chooses to do it his charecter could be a zombie survival expert or some kid that doesn't know what the hell is going on (even though every one is 27 years old 0.0) that's the beauty of project zomboid you choose how to survive you don't need someone telling you how see if you would survive or not even in your own preffered apocalypse fast zombies slow zombies which ever you wish. I definitley recomend this game to any die hard zombie fan's that always wanted a perfect zombie game don't turn away from the graphics and let it play.And you may even wan't to relive your own apocalypse in your local area well you can do that too just download the map editor and make your own it's not that hard i promise....But This is an unfinished game so do expect some bug's and sure you cannot relive everything and thing's are missing BUT DON'T WORRY IT WILL ALL COME! :D i look forward to the day this game let's you fill up a bath with water and run over some zombies with the radio on listening to the army coming to kill everyone. If you actually read all of this i sulute you. :P

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 22, 2013
Early Access Review
								THE BEST Zombie survival game i have ever played, and i've played a few now!Graphics aren't the best in the world but it more than makes up for it in detail and game play. After approximately 2 months the water and electricity cut off, so by that time you need to have set up a base(2 storey buildings recommended), barricaded doors and windows, crafted better melee weapons, made rope ladders from bed sheets(see what i mean about detail:)  built perimeter fences and water butts. Collect anything useful, which in this game is almost everything!Plant seeds to grow crops.Become completely self sufficient......and survive.More content to be added as this game is early access. I did have some problems getting game to work (cheers bruv) and do come across the odd bug, but this game in it's current state is VERY playable. Demo available, although i've heard (not played it) it doesn't give justice to the full game. Good idea if you are worried about beta issues though. Full game only ¬£10 well worth it in my opinion!!!!EDIT: 250hrs+ and still going strong! Extra content added about every 3 months to stable branch, but experimental branch is constantly evolving. Animal hunting to be added in the near future, fishing and trapping already added to stable branch along with awesome shopping mall map update.Best ¬£10 i've ever spent!!!EDIT#2: 2 days short of a year since my last EDIT, this game is now so good, every time I play the game I run the risk of ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing my pants......and I'm not the only one! Infact, I have heard rumours that the dev's are considering putting a disclaimer in the store page before anyone becomes seriously injured.                                           !!YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!!

content:

Early Access Review
								An absolutely thrilling experience that compines the tedious work of basic survival with the intensity of flesh-eating zombies.  The soundtrack adds an eerie atmosphere to the game; the graphics, although not considered good looking, they have come to grow on me.  The style of the graphics really fits the tone of the game.  This game truly and honestly allows the player to experience zombie surival at it's best and most realistic.  The game is also being updated it seems somewhat frequently, making the game significantly better with each update.  I highly recommend this game to anyone who enjoys zombie survival games at all.  Even if you don't think you do, try it out with the demo; this game provides a never-before-seen experience that I have really enjoyed.  I love this game!

								A challenging survivor game with a lot of content. Similiar to many other survivor games, it doesn¬¥t offer any larger endgame scenario, but the distance of you "winning" the game is very long and there are lots of events between the two points of hopeless survival and eventually becoming fully self-contained and separated from the zombie apocalypse (kind of winning the game).The game master ai makes sure the zombie hordes evetually find you though.When you start playing, at least for me, the mechanic was a bit tricky to learn and the learning curve hits you in your face. But when you get over that it gets much better and soon as you learn to survive a bit longer, you start to care for your character, even though they don't really have a personality (at least yet)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 10, 2014
Early Access Review
								Defintiely a Thumbs Up for this game. Been playing it for days now and can't get enough of it....Starting off with nothing, looking for food, water, shelter while trying to stay alive among the Zombies. Once a home is established, one has to look for things such as axes, farming seeds, nails, medical supplies, saws, hammers etc. in order to start your own farm, fortify your home base or build rain collecting barrels for when water and electricity is shut off and food you could previously find in homes has already gone bad over time. The different game modes let you choose how you wish to play, in sandbox mode for instance zombies can be customized amongst other things such as loot and weather. Also, having skills that gain exp as you play, adds further awesomeness to the game.One thing that the game still needs, to really stand out, are NPCs though, but I've been told that they're on their way, amongst other planed features.In a nutshell, I'm quite happy that I found this game and I'm looking forward to the upcoming new features.

content:

								Project Zomboid, Zombie RPG:Project Zomboid is a very realistic Post-Apocalyptic Game that will immerse you in every new play through, with different experiences that will get you to make difficult decisions that will change how your character lives his life in a ever changing zombie apocalyptic world. You as the player take control over everything that happens, whether its that you choose to risk staying the night in a zombified house or take sleeping pills that change your characters sleeping patterns.Project Zomboid is currently still in development, which is truly amazing, because the game right now conveys a extremely playable version even if it‚Äôs only in Beta. The game is being worked on and further development updates are being released to give the players more content to play around with. Updates are very consistent and nearly always add more content to the game (unless it‚Äôs a bug fix update which are also frequent).If you‚Äôre the type of person that enjoys a completely realistic and immersive, zombie apocalyptic experience, where every character has a different to story to tell, with every play through. Then Project Zomboid is for YOU.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 2, 2014
Early Access Review
								Wonderful game.It's literally how the end times would be.You need food, weapons, shelter.You get depressed, you get hungry, infected.Each character can be customized with special skills and downfalls.Lots of customizing on bases, it's fun being in a close call situation.once you die, you die!You can rank up skills the longer you stay alive.You can even craft! Water goes out, electricity goes out. You need people to watch your back.The few downfalls of the game I see are as follows.1. Hard to find servers and connect to active ones. They need to put the server list into the game system.2. Crops are almost pointless in multiplayer. Though this would be your main way of surviving, it's almost pointless. You wait for HOURS and HOURS for these crops to grow. Then you harvest ONE and then go to bed, wake up and BAM everything isr rotten. You have to water them non stop also. 3. There needs to be ways to save food for a little longer. Using salt on meat, or burying food in the ground or something.4. Needs more weapons. Guns, blades, etc.I would check this game out, it's worth every penny. But it still needs a little fine tuning. But the game is very playable.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 13, 2014
Early Access Review
								So far, I have experienced nothing on the level with this game in terms of survival.   I hope this title continues to push the envelope in gameplay mechanics, hell, it may very well be the most fun and creative co-op experience to date.  Unique game that might slip under the radar in the mix with games based around kills, which would be a shame considering this game is HIGHLY focused around surviving, instead of mindless waves of ineffective zombies, encounters with the infected are highly dangerous. Just know, all it takes is one scratch or bite and the onset of infection could sink in leaving you with nothing but an untimely demise in your near future.Creative minds and resourcefullness can result in unforseen events, usually resulting in personal injury, property damage and even the occasional missing person.

								This is the number #1 best zombie crafting/survival game out there. I have played a great deal of survival as well as crafting games but none have givin the variety and depth of zomboid. even in its current state without its wealth of planned features you cant beat it. I highly recomend it to anyone looking for a open world zombie game full of stuff to do. such as nailing a sheet to a second story window for escape, rain barrels to collet water for when the power fails (which it will and you must plan ahead), useing a sledgehammer to connect safe houses, or just building your own. You have to eat, drink, treat wounds, fight off sickness as well as zombies, heck you can even get wet from rain and that has a chance to make you sick if you dont dry off with something.This game is as deep as they come and it will only get better with time. keep up the good work indie stone 10/10 even in its early access state.

content:
Posted: November 20, 2013
Early Access Review
								Update: It's worth noting that the game now has working multiplayer. You can host your own servers without even needing VPN software like Hamachi or Evolve.I first played this game in it's alpha state on Desura and it simply is THE best (zombie) survival game I have seen. Emphasis on 'survival'. You know how minecraft has a "survival" mode? Yeah Project Zomboid does the survival aspect the way you'd really expect it to be done.Surviving in this game is really challenging; you start in your own house and all you have are your clothes and whatever items you can find from all the drawers and the fridge. You'll have to mind the weather, make sure you have food and drink, obviously watch out not to get bitten, find medical supplies in case you get sick and so on. You'll also need to find a good shelter, be it by barricading a house you find suitable or building your own from scratch..Definetly worth the money, I cannot recommend this game enough.

content:
Posted: June 22, 2014
Early Access Review
								I've been a huge PZ fan since back during the old Kate and Baldspot days, so I was super excited when it came to Steam.+Huge locations, tons of looting.  Zombie killing, crafting, and survival tactics are varied, fun, and well implemented.+A lot of really creative ideas from a dev team that listens to community feedback and is constantly improving/adding.  Weekly blog also helps to keep players in the loop.+Gritty and immersive atmosphere.  Can be challenging, but still rewarding-Minor bugs (not crash inducing, but sigh inducing)-Constant updates means you will continously restart your character to enjoy new features.The only real disclaimer I would add is that it is Early Access and so there are many unfinished features.  The game is constantly changing and being updated, which means you are going to have to keep restarting your chanracter, losing your accumulated skills and your base/loot.For some easliy frustrated people, it would be better to wait until it is finished and pay a little more, but if you like zombie games and you like survival games, this one does so many things right - firmly placed at the top of my list over the slew of other similar games on the market.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 22, 2015
Early Access Review
								So, I've never really wrote a review for any Steam game but this one has bolstered me to do so. I've bought this game before it was even on Steam, I was instantly given the Steam copy with my old account. It seems trivial but this leads into the greater scale of the developers commitment to delivering to the consumer. Each Monday they release a "Mondoid"on their site, a news article letting us players know what they have been working on and how things are going.There have been ups and downs but this game progressively keeps getting tuned up and bit by bit, better. For an early access, every form of this game has been completely functional. The impressive amount of features they've been pumping into the game has made this ride worth it.After stroking the developers ego a little bit to much for even my own liking, I want to get into the game play. I'm sure others can describe it more eloquently than I, but it is pretty much the closest thing you will ever get to a real life zombie simulator. Fracture a leg? Tough luck, you're going to have to baby it for about a week until you might be able to run again? Hopping through a broken window? Ack! Cut your groin up on entry. There's plenty of examples to go with but the fact is, this game is unrelenting. I can't tell you how frustrating it is to get a scratch and having to wait to see if you are infected. Frustrating is generally bad but in the scheme of this game, you are trying to hang on to your survival at any means necessary. Sometimes the small achievements are good ones. Like when I was able to gather enough ammunition in an apocalyptic wasteland to fend off bandits, that resonated somewhere that I achieved something. The game punishes you, every success is awesome. Every failure, depressing. The thought that goes into this is unparalleled, with water and power turning off after a few weeks. This game is literally trying to cover every imaginable angle. I'd ramble on about every feature, but all I wanted/needed to convey was A) The Development team is solid and B) This is the best zombie survival sim I've ever played.

content:
Posted: April 29, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game is the only true zombie survival simulator. Sure, It doesn't have realistic graphics or first person mode like DayZ but this game is friggin HARD. You can go out, get yourself a shotgun and try to take down a hoard but more and more will be attracted to the sounds of your shots so you'd better have enough shells to take down every zombie in the sound radius. You'll need food and water, while you can get plenty of food your perishables will spoil and there's only so much ramen and jerky in the world. You'll need to keep moving into more and more dangerous areas. Water will be cut off so you'd better have a good stockpile of it before it runs out.I could really go on, Barricading your house, finding new food sources, finally saving enough bullets to take out a hoard and get though the cities but all I REALLY need to say is this. If you think you're a badass that will survive the zombie apocolypse think again. This game will show you no matter how badass you are, you're nobody special. It only takes one mistake on your part and you're zombie food. So yes, Buy this game. Hell, Buy 8 copies of it. This game is amazing.

content:

Early Access Review
								An absolutely thrilling experience that compines the tedious work of basic survival with the intensity of flesh-eating zombies.  The soundtrack adds an eerie atmosphere to the game; the graphics, although not considered good looking, they have come to grow on me.  The style of the graphics really fits the tone of the game.  This game truly and honestly allows the player to experience zombie surival at it's best and most realistic.  The game is also being updated it seems somewhat frequently, making the game significantly better with each update.  I highly recommend this game to anyone who enjoys zombie survival games at all.  Even if you don't think you do, try it out with the demo; this game provides a never-before-seen experience that I have really enjoyed.  I love this game!
